posts.name: Abuelo's Mexican Restaurant
posts.note: Abuelo's Mexican Restaurant is a Texas-based chain restaurant serving Mexican food and margaritas in a hacienda-style setting. From their website, 'We are passionate about our made-from-scratch dishes, each one made from the heart and crafted with pride from Chef Luis E. Sanchez’s family recipes. We use only the freshest, finest ingredients in all our dishes, from our scratch-made salsas, sauces, tortillas, and sides, to our hand-rolled enchiladas, traditional TexMex items, and unique House Specialties.'

posts.name: Barrio Cafe
posts.note: Barrio Cafe is a bustling eatery serving creative Mexican fare and over 200 tequilas in cozy digs filled with folk art. You should or order the fish in banana leaf, or the Cochinita Pibil which is pork is marinated in achiote and sour orange, wrapped in a banana leaf and slow roasted overnight, topped with pickled red onion and Yucatán-style pico de gallo for a meal or tacos. Don't forget to order the Tilapia wrapped in banana leaves or the smoked goat.

posts.name: El Guero Canelo Restaurant
posts.note: El Guero Canelo Restaurant is a series of food trailers doling out Sonoran-style hot dogs and Mexican street foods. From their website, 'Daniel Contreras opened his first hot dog stand in Tucson in 1993. As a boy, he ate, slept, and breathed baseball (he was nearly a champion at 12), now he puts that same drive into Sonoran food. He owns and operates three El Guero Canelo restaurants, a meat market in Tucson, a bakery and tortilla factory in Magdalena (he had to be sure the quality was just right).' Titus tweeted 'Sonoran Dog from El Güero Canelo (Tucson, AZ). Bacon-wrapped frank, pinto beans, grilled and raw onion, tomato, mayo, mustard, jalapeno sauce on a local bolillo roll. Originally a street-side stand, it won a James Beard “American Classic” award a few years back. Since 1993.' NOTE: They have multiple locations.

posts.name: La Santisima
posts.note: La Santisima serves inventive burritos, tacos, quesadillas, and are the forte of this counter-serve spot with a salsa bar. From their website, 'Our aim is to deliver everything that is exciting and fresh about Mexican cuisine to the people of Arizona, banishing old perceptions of heavy, greasy, taste bud-searing, so-called “Tex-Mex.&rdqou;'

posts.name: MacAlpine's Diner and Soda Fountain
posts.note: MacAlpine's Diner and Soda Fountain is a circa-1928 soda fountain with wooden booths, vintage decor, and retro food and drinks such as egg creams. From their Facebook, 'The popular homemade menu items we offer are made fresh every day, and our sundaes are to die for! Whether you prefer seafood chowder and club sandwiches or chicken Malibu and French onion soup, there's something for everyone in our establishment!'

posts.name: Matt’s Big Breakfast
posts.note: Matt’s Big Breakfast is a contemporary American cafe serving daytime fare, including breakfast, burgers, and sandwiches. NOTE: They have multiple locations.

posts.name: Mrs White's Golden Rule Cafe
posts.note: Mrs. White's Golden Rule Cafe is a modest, family-owned eatery serving home-style Southern and soul food seven days a week since the '60s. The dish to order from what I've heard is the smothered chicken fried steak along with the mac and cheese or deep-fried pork chops.

posts.name: Over Easy
posts.note: Over Easy is a local chain serving omelets, pancakes, and other breakfast classics in cheery, retro surrounds. NOTE: They have multiple locations.

posts.name: Tacos Chiwas
posts.note: Tacos Chiwas is a family owned restaurant focused on providing quality, excellent service, and preparing fresh food from recipes that have been passed down through generations. Order the rajas gordita which is the holy matrimony of steam and spice, a pliable pillow of puffed dough with a creamy core of beans, cheese and chiles that warms your fingers, burns your lips and buckles your knees with its disarmingly tender texture or the smoked beef cheek Barbacoa Tacos and the smoked brisket Deshebrada Roja Gorditas.

posts.name: Zemam's Too
posts.note: Zemam's is a family-owned, BYOB Ethiopian restaurant in a cozy converted house. You need to order the Doro Watt, a traditional chicken dish slowly cooked on the bone in a rich, spicy berbere sauce served with a hard-boiled egg (egg included on full order only). From the Phoenix Eater website, 'Zemam’s began as a five-seat restaurant almost 30 years ago. While the original Broadway location is temporarily closed, the secondary Speedway location still offers the icon’s Ethiopian cuisine with dishes such as beef simmered in spicy berbere sauce and spiced cauliflower roasted with peppers and garbanzo flour.'
